question: The simple Interest on a certain sum of money at the rate of 4% p.a.  for 5 years is Rs. 1680. At what rate of interest the same amount of interest can be received on the same sum after 4 years ?
The interest on a certain deposit at 4.5% p.a. is Rs. 405 in one year. How much will the additional interest in one year be on the same deposit at 5% p.a. ?
solution:
S.I. = Rs. 405 R = 4.5% T = 1 year
Principal = (100 *405)/(4.5*1) = Rs.9000
S.I at 5% interest = (9000*5*1)/100 = Rs.450
Difference in interest = 450 – 405 = Rs.45

question: Mr.Govind invested an amount of Rs.13900  divided in two different schemes S1 and S2 at the simple interst rate of 14% p.a. and 11% p.a. respectively. If the total amount of simple interest earned in two years was Rs.3508, what was the amount invested in Scheme S2?
solution:
Let the sum invested in Scheme S1 be Rs.x and that in Scheme S2 be Rs.(13900-x).
Then, (x*14*2)/100 + ((13900-x)*11*2)/100 = 3508;
28x-22x= 3350800-(13900*22);
6x = 45000; x= 7500
So sum invested in Scheme S2 = Rs. (13900-7500) = Rs.6400

question: A sum of money was invested in a bank at 8%  simple interest p.a. for 3 years. Instead had it been invested in mutual fund at 8.5% p.a. simple interest for 4 years, the earning would have been Rs.500 more. What is the sum invested?
solution:
Let the sum be Rs.x
S.I from the bank = x*8*3/100 = 34x/100Earnings in the form of interest from mutual fund = (x * 8.5*4)/100 = 34x/100
Given that 34x/100 - 34x/100 = Rs.500 ; x = 5000
: . The sum invested = 5000

question: A person borrowed Rs.600 @ 3% per annum  S.I and Rs.800 @ 4½ % per annum on the agreement that the whole sum will be returned only when the total interest becomes Rs.246. The number of years, after which the borrowed sum is to be returned, is -
solution:
Let the time be x years. Then (600 *3* x)/100 + (800*9*x)/(2*100) = 24
18x+ 36x = 246 ; x = 246/54 = 4 years
Required time = 4 years
